titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity
Chapter 47 – The (Application of) the Henna after the Noura
Chapter 47 – The (Application of) the Henna after the Noura

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ بُنْدَارَ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ جَمِيعاً عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ الْأَحْمَرِ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ مُوسَى قَالَ كَانَ أَبِي مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا أَرَادَ دُخُولَ الْحَمَّامِ أَمَرَ أَنْ يُوقَدَ لَهُ عَلَيْهِ ثَلَاثاً وَ كَانَ لَا يُمْكِنُهُ دُخُولُهُ حَتَّى يَدْخُلَهُ السُّودَانُ فَيُلْقُونَ لَهُ اللُّبُودَ فَإِذَا دَخَلَهُ فَمَرَّةً قَاعِدٌ وَ مَرَّةً قَائِمٌ فَخَرَجَ يَوْماً مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ فَاسْتَقْبَلَهُ رَجُلٌ مِنْ آلِ الزُّبَيْرِ يُقَالُ لَهُ كُنَيْدٌ وَ بِيَدِهِ أَثَرُ حِنَّاءٍ فَقَالَ مَا هَذَا الْأَثَرُ بِيَدِكَ فَقَالَ أَثَرُ حِنَّاءٍ فَقَالَ وَيْلَكَ يَا كُنَيْدُ حَدَّثَنِي أَبِي وَ كَانَ أَعْلَمَ أَهْلِ زَمَانِهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ جَدِّهِ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ دَخَلَ الْحَمَّامَ فَاطَّلَى ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَهُ بِالْحِنَّاءِ مِنْ قَرْنِهِ إِلَى قَدَمِهِ كَانَ أَمَاناً لَهُ مِنَ الْجُنُونِ وَ الْجُذَامِ وَ الْبَرَصِ وَ الْآكِلَةِ إِلَى مِثْلِهِ مِنَ النُّورَةِ.

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ali Bin Muhammad Bin Bundar and Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, altogether from Ibrahim Bin Is’haq Al Ahmar, (It has been narrated) from Al-Husayn son of Musaasws who said, ‘My fatherasws Musaasws Bin Ja’farasws, whenever heasws wanted to enter the bathhouse, ordered that it should be ignited for him with three (people) being over it, and heasws would not enter it until the slaves enter it and they would be laying down the matting for him. So when heasws entered it, (into the bath) heasws would be seated for a while, and standing for a while.  So one day heasws came out from the bathhouse, and a man from the progeny of Al-Zubeyr called Kuneyd met himasws, and in hisasws hands were the traces of henna. So he said, ‘What are these traces in yourasws hands?’ So heasws said: ‘Traces of henna. Woe be unto you O Kuneyd! Myasws fatherasws narrated to me, and heasws was the most knowledgeable of the people of hisasws time, from hisasws fatherasws, from hisasws grandfatherasws having said: ‘Rasool-Allahsaww said: ‘The one who enters the bathhouse, so he waxes, then follows it up with the henna from his head to his feet, it would be a safety for him from the insanity, and the leprosy, and the vitiligo, and the corrosion to such like, from the Noura’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ مَيْسَرَةَ عَنِ الْحَكَمِ بْنِ عُتَيْبَةَ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ قَدْ أَخَذَ الْحِنَّاءَ وَ جَعَلَهُ عَلَى أَظَافِيرِهِ فَقَالَ يَا حَكَمُ مَا تَقُولُ فِي هَذَا فَقُلْتُ مَا عَسَيْتُ أَنْ أَقُولَ فِيهِ وَ أَنْتَ تَفْعَلُهُ وَ إِنَّ عِنْدَنَا يَفْعَلُهُ الشُّبَّانُ فَقَالَ يَا حَكَمُ إِنَّ الْأَظَافِيرَ إِذَا أَصَابَتْهَا النُّورَةُ غَيَّرَتْهَا حَتَّى تُشْبِهَ أَظَافِيرَ الْمَوْتَى فَغَيِّرْهَا بِالْحِنَّاءِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Muawiya Bin Maysara, from Al Hakam Bin Uteyba who said, ‘I saw Abu Ja’farasws and heasws had taken the henna and made it to be upon hisasws nails, so heasws said: ‘O Hakam! What are you saying regarding this?’ So I said, ‘What can I say and youasws have done it, and among us it is the youth who do it’. So heasws said: ‘O Hakam! When the nails are hit by the Noura, it changes them until they resemble the nails of the dead, therefore change it back by the henna’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا رَفَعَهُ قَالَ مَنِ اطَّلَى فَتَدَلَّكَ بِالْحِنَّاءِ مِنْ قَرْنِهِ إِلَى قَدَمِهِ نُفِيَ عَنْهُ الْفَقْرُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from one of our companions, raising it, 
‘He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The one who waxes and massages with the henna from his head to his feet, the poverty is negated from him’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ عُبْدُوسِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ قَدْ خَرَجَ مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ وَ هُوَ مِنْ قَرْنِهِ إِلَى قَدَمِهِ مِثْلُ الْوَرْدَةِ مِنْ أَثَرِ الْحِنَّاءِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ahmad Bin Ubdous Bin Ibrahim who said, 
‘I saw Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> and he<sup>asws</sup> had come out from the bathhouse, and he<sup>asws</sup> was like the rose from his<sup>asws</sup> head to his<sup>asws</sup> feet, from the effects of the henna’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمَّادٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ عُقْبَةَ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ مُوسَى قَالَ كَانَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) مَعَ رَجُلٍ عِنْدَ قَبْرِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) فَنَظَرَ إِلَيْهِ وَ قَدْ أَخَذَ الْحِنَّاءَ مِنْ يَدَيْهِ فَقَالَ بَعْضُ أَهْلِ الْمَدِينَةِ أَ مَا تَرَوْنَ إِلَى هَذَا كَيْفَ أَخَذَ الْحِنَّاءَ مِنْ يَدَيْهِ فَالْتَفَتَ إِلَيْهِ فَقَالَ لَهُ فِيهِ مَا تَخْبُرُهُ وَ مَا لَا تَخْبُرُهُ ثُمَّ الْتَفَتَ إِلَيَّ فَقَالَ إِنَّهُ مَنْ أَخَذَ مِنَ الْحِنَّاءِ بَعْدَ فَرَاغِهِ مِنِ اطِّلَاءِ النُّورَةِ مِنْ قَرْنِهِ إِلَى قَدَمِهِ أَمِنَ مِنَ الْأَدْوَاءِ الثَّلَاثَةِ الْجُنُونِ وَ الْجُذَامِ وَ الْبَرَصِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ali Bin Muhammad, form Salih Bin Abu Hammad, from Ibrahim Bin Uqba, from Al Husayn Bin Musa who said, ‘Abu Al-Hassanasws was with a man in the presence of the grave of Rasool-Allahsaww, so he looked at himasws and heasws had applied henna upon hisasws hands. So one of the people of Al-Medina said, ‘Are you not looking at this one how heasws has applied the henna upon hisasws hands?’ So heasws turned towards him and said to him: ‘In it is what you are informed of and what you are not informed of’. Then heasws turned towards me, so heasws said: ‘The one who takes from the henna after him having been freed from the waxing of the Noura, from his head to his feet, is safe from three illnesses – the insanity, and the leprosy, and the vitiligo’.
